question: string — the specific question being investigated

quick_reference.title: string — table heading, e.g. 'Recommended Exclusions'
quick_reference.notes: string — optional caveat shown below the table

key_findings: string — each finding as a standalone insight

concepts.name: string — the term or concept
concepts.description: string — plain English explanation, suitable for someone unfamiliar with the term

tensions: string — each tradeoff or competing force

engineering_leadership.headline: string — one punchy sentence: the single most important takeaway
engineering_leadership.so_what: string — business or risk impact in 1-2 sentences. Why should leadership care?
bullets: string — 3-5 hard-hitting points focused on impact, risk, or decision triggers. Technical terms allowed but no deep-dive mechanics.
engineering_leadership.action_required: string — what leadership needs to decide or act on, or null if none

product_owner.headline: string — plain English, zero jargon. What is this issue in one sentence?
product_owner.so_what: string — what this means for the product or users in 1-2 sentences. No technical terms.
bullets: string — 3-5 bullets a non-engineer can understand and act on. Spell out any acronyms.

next_steps.po_action: string — what the PO/EM needs to decide or kick off. They own this step.
work_to_assign: string — discrete work items the PO/EM assigns to engineers.
next_steps.leadership_input: string — what architects or senior ICs need to weigh in on before or during the work, or null if none needed.

questions_to_ask_engineering: string — 1-3 questions the PO can bring into an engineering conversation to stay informed
